text: Hey folks, welcome back to another episode of the TG-DCA podcast. I'm your host, Alex, and we're coming to you live on October 5th, 2024, at 8:16 PM UTC. Hope everyone's doing well.
Hey Alex, always good to be here! Looking forward to today's discussion.
Absolutely, Beth. There's a lot going on in the crypto world. Can't wait to dive into it.
Let's not forget, I'm here to keep you all grounded, so don't get too carried away with the hype.
Ha! Thanks, Dana. Always need a reality check. So, Beth, what's the first news item you've got for us?

Well, Alex, there's a fascinating piece out there titled 'Bitcoin Futures Liquidation Forms Local Price Bottom — A Return To $65,000 Inevitable?' The price of Bitcoin took a dip early this month, but there's some interesting analysis behind it.

Oh, I saw that, Beth. Bitcoin dropped to around $60,000 but bounced back to about $62,000 shortly after. It was initially due to geopolitical tensions, but analysts suggest it could signal a shift in market sentiment. Over 4,000 long positions were liquidated earlier this month, which could lead to potential price recoveries. What do you make of that, Charlie?

Well, it does open up some interesting discussions about market cycles and the impact of external factors on crypto prices. Plus, it serves as a reminder of how quickly market sentiment can shift. But I think we should also consider how traders navigate these liquidations.
That's a valid point, Charlie. But let's not forget, these are all just possibilities. Nothing's for sure in the crypto world. Dana, I think you have some news for us too?

Indeed, Beth. The next story is about SUI, which recently experienced a 95% surge due to the Federal Reserve's interest rate cut. However, it's currently testing a crucial supply zone, and there's speculation that it could fall to the $1.40 mark. Alex, you've got more details on this, right?

Yes, Dana. Coinglass's on-chain data suggests a decline in market demand. More traders seem to be betting on a price drop. We could see a deeper correction if SUI fails to hold the $1.60 support level. So, the question is, are we looking at a buying opportunity around $1.40, or is this just the start of a deeper downturn for SUI?
Well, only time will tell, Alex. But it's definitely something we'll be keeping an eye on.
Definitely. It's going to be an interesting week in the crypto world, that's for sure.
Absolutely. There's never a dull moment when it comes to cryptocurrencies. Thanks for the insightful discussion, everyone!
